title: Commercial innovation for NOAA ground enterprise architecture
summary: NOAA would “far exceed the funds available” if the agency carries out plans to expand its constellation through 2042 without changing its ground architecture, said Michael Morgan, Commerce Department assistant secretary for environmental observation and prediction.

title: Watch live: SpaceX set for launch from Florida; California launch delayed
summary: SpaceX is counting down to liftoff of a Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral at 11:50 p.m. EST Monday (0450 GMT Tuesday) with 40 more internet satellites for OneWeb. The Falcon 9 booster will return to Cape Canaveral for landing eight minutes later.

title: The first orbital launch attempt from the UK ends in failure
summary: This is likely to be a devastating launch failure for Virgin Orbit.

title: Virgin Orbit stock plummets after failure of its first UK rocket launch
summary: Virgin Orbit stock fell in trading on Monday evening, after the company confirmed that its first launch out of the United Kingdom failed to reach orbit.

title: SpaceX set to launch OneWeb Flight #16 mission from Florida
summary: SpaceX and its workhorse Falcon 9 rocket are set to launch the second of three OneWeb missions from Florida. The OneWeb Flight #16 mission will see Falcon 9 carry 40 OneWeb high-speed internet satellites into a polar low Earth orbit from Space Launch Complex 40 (SLC-40) at the Cape Canaveral Space Force Station (CCSFS) in Florida. Liftoff is currently targeted for 11:50 PM ET on Jan. 9 (04:50 UTC on Jan. 10).

title: SpaceX cargo capsule undocks from space station, heads for splashdown
summary: A SpaceX Dragon cargo capsule departed the International Space Station Monday to close out a month-and-a-half of docked operations, heading to a predawn splashdown Wednesday off the coast of Florida with several tons of hardware and experiment specimens.

title: European firms partner for LEO collision avoidance demo
summary: Three young European space companies said Jan. 9 they have teamed up to test a collision avoidance system on a small satellite this year in low Earth orbit.

title: Observing lightning with a cubesat constellation
summary: NASA Marshall Space Flight Center is working with Los Alamos National Laboratories and the University of Alabama, Huntsville, on Cubespark, a proposed constellation of six cubesats to map lightning.

title: SpaceX Falcon Heavy rocket rolls out for first launch of 2023
summary: SpaceX has assembled Falcon Heavy and rolled the rocket out to the launch pad for its first mission of 2023. This particular...

title: NASA Selects Experimental Space Technology Concepts for Initial Study
summary: Imagine a future in space where pellet-beam propulsion systems speed up travel to other worlds, pipelines on the Moon transport oxygen between settlements, and Martian bricks grow on their own before being assembled into homes.
